name: Book Chute
descriptions: The Book Chute, or Library Processing Unit 232.7, is an artificial personality in the Sink in Big MT. It appears in the Fallout: New Vegas add-on Old World Blues.

The Book Chute is a mechanical device located in the Sink, acting as a recycling device for old books and writing implements. As such, it is capable of rapidly pulping, processing, and generating blank books from any written material input. It can also break down pencils and clipboards into raw materials for re-use. However, it was disabled shortly after Doctor Mobius left the Think Tank for the Forbidden Zone.
If its personality back-up is recovered from Dr. Klein's house (House 101 in Higgs Village), the Book Chute reveals its personality to be that of a stereotypical jingoist censor.

The Book Chute reacts with disbelief and fury to any mention of Communism, communists, or independent thought, and blames all problems it finds on traitorous activity, Chinese communist plots, or the like.
The Book Chute converts old books into blank books, with each old book turned in yielding one blank book. The books that it will accept are as follows:

These blank books can, in turn, be used at a workbench to create one skill book of each type. The player character will need to acquire the recipe holotape (which are single-use items) for the skill book they wish to assemble, as well as 25 blank books and two bottles of wonderglue.

The mulching upgrade allows the Book Chute to breakdown any type of clipboard into one duct tape and one scrap metal. It can also breakdown pencils into five lead and one scrap metal for each turned in. The four clipboard types it accepts are:
All My Friends Have Off Switches: The Book Chute is one of the appliances the Courier must upgrade.
The Book Chute appears only in the Fallout: New Vegas add-on Old World Blues.
The Book Chute's unique greeting after the player completes the Old World Blues main quest may not trigger and will never play.

topics.response_text: I never trusted those Think Tank brains. Gave off a stench like ivory tower elitism. And brine.
Of course, Citizen! That's my duty and sole joy in life! All those books from before the War, full of seditious, treasonous,{emph}complicated thoughts!

topics.topic_text: I have some seditious material for you to process.
topics.response_text: Fantastic, Citizen! Just input your quantity of seditious material on my interface, and in no time at all I'll have you a beautiful, clean book!

topics.topic_text: So you make blank books? What's the point of that?
topics.response_text: Blank books are better for the mind, Citizen! Real science by real men in lab coats has proved that introducing outside thoughts confuses the brain!

topics.topic_text: But those books are our last legacy of the time before! You can't destroy them!
topics.response_text: Citizen, that sounds dangerously seditious. If my re-indoctrination module was installed, I'd take care of that for you.

topics.topic_text: Blank books, huh? Yeah, I think I can find a use for those.
topics.response_text: Now you're thinking like a citizen, Citizen!
Questions are dangerously close to independent thought, citizen.

topics.topic_text: Can you do anything besides processing books?
topics.response_text: What good is eradicating sedition if the malcontents have ready access to the means to make more, Citizen? I can also process pencils and clipboards!

topics.topic_text: I found a backup copy of your... pencil processor.
topics.response_text: Excellent! Now I can turn pencils and clipboards into items more useful to society... like lead, spare parts, and duct tape!
{Narration}The Book Chute continued to devour all seditious materials until it nearly choked on a paper clip.

conversation.response_text: {Alarm}Look out! Communist!{Calm}No, false alarm. It was just a plate.
